posts.name: BrianAtlanta
posts.cooked:
When we use the ctre tuner, we see our pro license on all devices. When we run the generated drive train code, we’re having an issue with our turn motors (falcons) as not licensed, getting a code error about not allowed to use a pro feature.

@bhall-ctre , not sure if you’ve seen this before.

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked:
Does the licensing icon on the devices in Tuner X show up as LIC or PRO?

If they show up as LIC, then the devices think they shouldn’t be licensed. Make sure that you set up your roboRIO and radio to the correct team number (note that imaging the roboRIO 2 does not set the team number). Also make sure everything is on 2025 software and firmware.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.custom_user_title: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked:
Adding on to this, licensing is not required for any functionality of the Swerve API. It improves odometry a bit on CANivore due to time-sync and enables FOC , which gives a bit of an efficiency bump on the motors.

It does give a warning by default as it defaults to FusedCANcoder, which internally falls back to RemoteCANcoder (but prints a warning) when unlicensed, so it’s a safe warning to ignore.

Are you having issues actually running the robot?

posts.name: BrianAtlanta
posts.cooked: I was told that they show up a pro in the tuner

posts.name: BrianAtlanta
posts.cooked:
daltzsmith:

It does give a warning by default as it defaults to FusedCANcoder, which internally falls back to RemoteCANcoder (but prints a warning) when unlicensed,

That’s what we’re seeing.

posts.name: BrianAtlanta
posts.cooked:
More info.   I swapped from RIO to RIO2, if there is any license data on the rio.   Also, our programming mentor wanted me to try this…

Connect to the rio over usb.  run the rio imaging tool.  don’t image.  it’s already done.  reset the team number on the rio.  restart.  see if the license error stops.

He thought about that after we left.

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked:
I would double check that is actually the case. Whether the device is actively Pro licensed is determined by whether the icon shows LIC (not licensed) or PRO (licensed), not by the list of licenses in the popup when you click on the device. The device can have licenses installed but not active (such as a 2024 license when running 2025 firmware).

If you just switched to a roboRIO 2, then you probably just need to set the team number.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.custom_user_title: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.cooked:
I had a similar issue Friday…. Fixed on Saturday with no code or TunerX changes…. The robot was power cycled.  Friday we were tethered via USB.  Saturday we were connected via WiFi.  Brand new Rio2 that was never connected via WiFi/Radio prior to Saturday.  Licenses were activated via USB tether.

Possible that license check gets the team number from the IP?  And that was defaulting to 10.0.1.2 due to the default on the radio?

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked: Season Pass requires both the roboRIO and the radio to be configured with the correct team number.
